Package com.amazon.ata.lists.classroom.stringbuilder

Class ATAStringBuilder

java.lang.Object
com.amazon.ata.lists.classroom.stringbuilder.ATAStringBuilder
public class ATAStringBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
A mutable sequence of characters.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ATAStringBuilder()
    COMPLETION 1 Constructs a string builder with no characters in it.

    COMPLETION 1 Constructs a string builder initialized to the contents of the specified string.

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • length

      public int length()
      COMPLETION 2 Returns the length (character count).
      Returns:
      the length of the sequence of characters currently represented by this object

    • append

      public ATAStringBuilder append​(java.lang.String str)
      COMPLETION 2 Appends the specified string.

      The characters of the String argument are appended, in order, increasing the length of this sequence by the length of the argument. If str is null, then the four characters "null" are appended.

      Parameters:
      str - a string, to be appended.
      Returns:
      a reference to this object.

    • insert

      public ATAStringBuilder insert​(int offset, char c)
      COMPLETION 2 Inserts the char argument into this sequence.

      The offset argument must be greater than or equal to 0, and less than or equal to the length of this sequence.

      Parameters:
      offset - the offset.
      c - a char.
      Returns:
      a reference to this object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset is invalid.

    • charAt

      public char charAt​(int index)
      COMPLETION 2 Returns the char value in this sequence at the specified index. The first char value is at index 0, the next at index 1, and so on, as in array indexing.

      The index argument must be greater than or equal to 0, and less than the length of this sequence.

      Parameters:
      index - the index of the desired char value.
      Returns:
      the char value at the specified index.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than or equal to length().

    • setCharAt

      public ATAStringBuilder setCharAt​(int index, char ch)
      EXTENSION 1

      The character at the specified index is set to ch. This sequence is altered to represent a new character sequence that is identical to the old character sequence, except that it contains the character ch at position index.

      The index argument must be greater than or equal to 0, and less than the length of this sequence.

      Parameters:
      index - the index of the character to modify.
      ch - the new character.
      Returns:
      This object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than or equal to length().

    • deleteCharAt

      public ATAStringBuilder deleteCharAt​(int index)
      EXTENSION 1

      Removes the char at the specified position in this sequence. This sequence is shortened by one.

      Parameters:
      index - Index of char to remove
      Returns:
      This object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is negative or greater than or equal to length().

    • substring

      public java.lang.String substring​(int start, int end)
      EXTENSION 2

      Returns a new String that contains a subsequence of characters currently contained in this sequence. The substring begins at the specified start and extends to the character at index end - 1.

      Parameters:
      start - The beginning index, inclusive.
      end - The ending index, exclusive.
      Returns:
      The new string.
      Throws:
      java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - if start or end are negative or greater than length(), or start is greater than end.

    • insert

      public ATAStringBuilder insert​(int offset, java.lang.String str)
      EXTENSION 2

      Inserts the string into this builder.

      The characters of the String argument are inserted, in order, into this sequence at the indicated offset, moving up any characters originally above that position and increasing the length of this sequence by the length of the argument.

      If str is null, then the four characters "null" are inserted into this sequence.

      The offset argument must be greater than or equal to 0, and less than or equal to the length of this sequence.

      Parameters:
      offset - the offset where the string should be inserted.
      str - a string, to be inserted.
      Returns:
      a reference to this object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset is invalid.

    • append

      public ATAStringBuilder append​(java.lang.Object obj)
      EXTENSION 2

      Appends the string representation of the Object argument, using the method String.valueOf.

      If obj is null, then the four characters "null" are appended.

      Parameters:
      obj - an Object, to be appended.
      Returns:
      a reference to this object.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
